message: In the long run, which is better for a potentially large Rails app?
If you don't count the AWS failure a few days ago, S3 as the read/write filesystem is great.
I like the built in full text search in PostgreSQL and Heroku is pretty darn easy to work with.

I'm a huge fan of Heroku, and moving off of it is the last solution I look at when solving problems. Some say it's expensive, but you don't have to pay somebody to deal with infrastructure crap (or do it yourself). If you have really specific needs, like you NEED filesystem access, then maybe Heroku won't work (but even the need for a w/r FS can be worked around).
I haven't played around with Engine Yard. Is it more complicated to deploy to?
@tmornini Hi Tom. Thanks for jumping in. So with Engine Yard, to increase concurrency, do I add additional (or larger) instances?
I'd be happy to answer any questions you have about Engine Yard. I'm @tmornini on Twitter!
